name: reweigh
content:
reweigh verb [T]
(OBJECTS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to weigh something again to find out how heavy it is: Compounds are added to the raw rubber and the final mix is reweighed. If the carrier suspects the weight is inaccurate, they will charge a fee to re-weigh and re-class the shipment.
More examplesFewer examplesEach parcel of butter is tasted and then re-weighed before a buyer will accept it.

reweigh verb [T]
(FACTS)
to consider information again carefully, in order to reach a decision: They use probabilities to weigh and reweigh the risks and rewards of every decision. The court cannot re-weigh the evidence and set aside the verdict simply because it feels some other result would be more reasonable.
More examplesFewer examplesIt is not our role to re-weigh this judgment.
